Class StructuredList

Structured Lists represent related tabular data. For larger datasets consider a full Table.

See demo

See structured-list/usage for usage guidance.

A basic structued list looks something like:

    <ibm-structured-list>
        <ibm-list-header>
            <ibm-list-column nowrap="true">Column 1</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column nowrap="true">Column 2</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column>Column 3</ibm-list-column>
        </ibm-list-header>
        <ibm-list-row>
            <ibm-list-column>Row 1</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column nowrap="true">Row One</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column>
                Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
                consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc dui magna,
                finibus id tortor sed, aliquet bibendum augue.
                Aenean posuere sem vel euismod dignissim. Nulla ut cursus dolor.
                Pellentesque vulputate nisl a porttitor interdum.
            </ibm-list-column>
        </ibm-list-row>
        <ibm-list-row>
            <ibm-list-column>Row 2</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column nowrap="true">Row Two</ibm-list-column>
            <ibm-list-column>
                Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
                consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc dui magna,
                finibus id tortor sed, aliquet bibendum augue.
                Aenean posuere sem vel euismod dignissim. Nulla ut cursus dolor.
                Pellentesque vulputate nisl a porttitor interdum.
            </ibm-list-column>
        </ibm-list-row>
    </ibm-structured-list>

../../iframe.html?id=structured-list--basic

Protected _skeleton

_skeleton: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:141

border

@Input()
border: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:94

Set to true to apply a border and white background.

condensed

@Input()
condensed: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:98

Set to true to apply a condensed style to the headers and rows.

headers

@ContentChildren({"selector":"ListHeader"})
headers: QueryList<ListHeader>
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:139

name

@Input()
name: string = `structured-list-${StructuredList.listCount++}`
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:106

Used when selection = true as the row radio group name

nowrap

@Input()
nowrap: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:102

Set to true to apply white-space: nowrap on all conent.

rows

@ContentChildren({"selector":"ListRow"})
rows: QueryList<ListRow>
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:138

selected

@Output()
selected: EventEmitter<object> = new EventEmitter()
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:136

Emits an event when the row selection changes.

Emits an object that looks like:

{
    value: "something",
    selected: true,
    name: "structured-list-1"
}

selection

@Input()
selection: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:90

Set to true to enable radio like selection of the rows.

Static listCount

listCount: number = 0
  • Defined in src/structured-list/structured-list.component.ts:86

A counter to provide unique default values.
